items.content_html:
Description of changes

git-bug has moved into the git-bug organization. This change updates the fetchFromGitHub call to fetch directly from git-bug/git-bug instead of relying on what is now a 301 redirection (that lives only at GitHub's discretion).

Description of changes

I'm a maintainer of git-bug, and would like to contribute to nixpkgs by becoming a maintainer of this package.

For verification purposes, my key is available on keys.openpgp.org:

items.title: git-bug: add maintainer: sudoforge

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This makes it possible to include git commit and tag signature verification when using fetchgit.

The motivation for this is to enable maintainers to ensure an update to the source code was authorized by the developers.
As signing keys are supposed to stay the same over multiple versions, they should remain unchanged when updating to a new revision of a given source code.

The verification is done in a non-fixed-output derivation so it will always be executed.

The pr mimics the behaviior of the verified-fetches experimental feature introduced by NixOS/nix#8848.

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This feels really out-of-place and (1) it's broken with current nixos-unstable (throwing 500), (2) cgit has its own "enable-http-clone" which is even enabled by default.

If someone genuinely needs it, I could put it behind an enabled-enable-flag, but first teach me how to fix it to work with the default value of the module's options.

items.title: nixos/cgit: drop superfluos git-http-backend

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This change is another take on #328937.

This PR is taking a different approach. Instead of adding the git directory in the install folder, I use the vcpkg-bundle.json file. That file can instruct vcpkg of the current git revision without shipping the actual git history in the repo. It can also instruct vcpkg that the filesystem is immutable, so it won't attempt to fetch a different revisions.

This as for effect of supporting arbitrary baselines, since vcpkg will use the mutable tree instead as it's download location instead of its own git root.

There was one problem implementing this PR is that vcpkg expects to read vcpkg-bundle.json as a sibling file to the executable file. Since the vcpkg root is using a wrapper script, it tries to read at the wrong location. I don't think we can move the vcpkg-bundle.json file to vcpkg-tool, since it contains the git revision of vcpkg. I instead opted to patch vcpkg to read the bundle json file from the root directory instead.

Bonus, it fixes the disable metrics, which suffered from the same problem as the bundle file.

items.title: git-pr: init at 0.0.2

items.content_html:
Motivation for this change

This is required for doing anything with git-cvsimport. I thought
about adding a cvsSupport option like for Subversion, but it only adds
0.1MB to the closure size, and is only added when perl support is
enabled anyway, so it's not worth it.

Things done
  • Tested using sandboxing (nix.useSandbox on NixOS, or option sandbox in nix.conf on non-NixOS linux)
  • Built on platform(s)
    • NixOS
    • macOS
    • other Linux distributions
  • Tested via one or more NixOS test(s) if existing and applicable for the change (look inside nixos/tests)
  • Tested compilation of all pkgs that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review wip"
  • Tested execution of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • Determined the impact on package closure size (by running nix path-info -S before and after)
  • Ensured that relevant documentation is up to date
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.

items.title: Update riseup-vpn 21.11 -> git

items.content_html:
Automatic update generated by nixpkgs-update tools. This update was made based on information from https://repology.org/project/git-subrepo/versions.

meta.description for git-subrepo is: Git submodule alternative

meta.homepage for git-subrepo is: https://github.com/ingydotnet/git-subrepo

Updates performed
  • Version update
To inspect upstream changes

  • Release on GitHub

  • Compare changes on GitHub

Impact

Checks done

  • built on NixOS
  • The tests defined in passthru.tests, if any, passed
  • found 0.4.9 with grep in /nix/store/14j20vyzkw2viz3lxc14wn1j8dipsbi1-git-subrepo-0.4.9
  • found 0.4.9 in filename of file in /nix/store/14j20vyzkw2viz3lxc14wn1j8dipsbi1-git-subrepo-0.4.9
Rebuild report (if merged into master) (click to expand) 
2 total rebuild path(s)

2 package rebuild(s)

First fifty rebuilds by attrpath

git-subrepo
Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/14j20vyzkw2viz3lxc14wn1j8dipsbi1-git-subrepo-0.4.9 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A git-subrepo https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/ad4e9d57738e137736a14a5e263cb5d2647e609f.tar.gz

Or:

nix build github:r-ryantm/nixpkgs/ad4e9d57738e137736a14a5e263cb5d2647e609f#git-subrepo

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/14j20vyzkw2viz3lxc14wn1j8dipsbi1-git-subrepo-0.4.9
ls -la /nix/store/14j20vyzkw2viz3lxc14wn1j8dipsbi1-git-subrepo-0.4.9/bin

Pre-merge build results

We have automatically built all packages that will get rebuilt due to
this change.

This gives evidence on whether the upgrade will break dependent packages.
Note sometimes packages show up as failed to build independent of the
change, simply because they are already broken on the target branch.

Result of nixpkgs-review run on x86_64-linux 1

1 package built:
  • git-subrepo
Maintainer pings

cc @ryantrinkle for testing.
items.title: git-subrepo: 0.4.6 -> 0.4.9

items.content_html:
Motivation for this change

When running nix run nixpkgs.git-lfs -c git-lfs install, the update git config and the generated hook do not refer to git-lfs in its full path resulting in GUI applications and CLI commands outside of nix-shell to fail.

Patch git-lfs to install the git-lfs hook and configuration using the absolute path to the git-lfs command. Doing so makes the git-lfs installation pure as it won't depend on an impure PATH.

Things done
  • Tested using sandboxing (nix.useSandbox on NixOS, or option sandbox in nix.conf on non-NixOS linux)
  • Built on platform(s)
    • NixOS
    • macOS
    • other Linux distributions
  • Tested via one or more NixOS test(s) if existing and applicable for the change (look inside nixos/tests)
  • Tested compilation of all pkgs that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review wip"
  • Tested execution of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • Determined the impact on package closure size (by running nix path-info -S before and after)
  • Ensured that relevant documentation is up to date
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.

closes #85264

items.title: llvmPackages_{18,git}: enable modules

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This adds the minimal version of Git in the minimal NixOS installation CD, and otherwise uses the default value of programs.git.package

The GUI installer live CDs will now have pkgs.git, and the minimal live CDs will now have pkgs.gitMinimal.

Closes #325924

Things done

I have tested both the minimal and graphical installation CDs with this change.

items.title: git-autoshare: init at 1.0.0b6

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Reduce the number of patches we have by finding duplicates. Modify getVersionFile in common/default.nix to branch to min/max version patches so we only have to keep 1 copy of a specific version of a patch.

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux

items.title: llvmPackages_{12,13,14,15,16,17,18,19,git}: commonify patches

items.content_html:
Git test t1700 was disabled for Git v2.18.0 in 6dda53a (git: add install checks, 2018-04-13). I've confirmed it's now working, at least on x86_64 Linux, with Git v2.45.1, so re-enable the test.

Description of changes

Remove patch to disable the t1700 test

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
